channel.title: 华尔街日报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey has triggered a debate among tech stalwarts over how decentralized the future internet may be https://t.co/Trd6BMjt2h
Meet the ham sniffers of Spain. (Yes, their job is to sniff hams.) And this is their busy season. https://t.co/UMrIiueKXR

New evidence has emerged that the Omicron variant may cause significantly less serious disease than earlier strains of Covid-19, as infections hit records in some parts of the U.S. https://t.co/fBX28L82f8

President Biden said he's eager to run for reelection against Donald Trump in 2024, and expressed regret that he didn’t act more quickly to distribute Covid-19 tests to the public https://t.co/wfJDMPxubK

Amazon said all workers at its hundreds of U.S. warehouses will have to wear masks again starting Wednesday, a mandate prompted by the rapid spread of the coronavirus’s Omicron variant https://t.co/8gJhlwu0Mu
Pop star Camila Cabello sold her Hollywood Hills home for $4.3 million after only nine days on the market https://t.co/66L91uN5uX
TikTok was the world’s most visited site on the internet in 2021, surpassing last year’s leader, Google https://t.co/p8r8GtqtpD
Pandemic stress, the erosion of boundaries between personal and professional spheres, and an exhausted slide toward casualness are making many of us swear more https://t.co/A4e1PlBeMg
At least $100 billion has been stolen from Covid-19 relief programs designed to help individuals and businesses harmed by the pandemic, the U.S. Secret Service said https://t.co/D6lbb2gpcz

The Omicron variant’s spread across the U.S. threatens to drive up cases, as many people head indoors during the cold weather. The season, it turns out, appears to play an important role in where Covid-19 strikes most. https://t.co/Cv861Um2Ra
President Biden extended the pause on student-loan payments to May 1. It had been scheduled to expire at the end of January. https://t.co/qRtuCyyjJf
Elon Musk says his primary home is a “kinda awesome” $50,000 house that he rents in South Texas near the Mexican border. He also has been living in a mansion in Austin. https://t.co/KpEbxMYZJ7
Breaking: The U.S. cleared use of a Covid-19 pill from Pfizer, the first drug that newly infected patients can now take at home to stay out of the hospital https://t.co/xsOgICOFyL
The risk of hospitalization from Omicron is substantially lower than from Delta, new studies in Scotland and South Africa suggest https://t.co/sK44728fNN
The Biden administration is considering another extension to the moratorium on student-loan payments put in place at the start of the pandemic https://t.co/kbTY0G1Hoy
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/qq4ZCyBiaa https://t.co/oAPTDzn4iK
On Friday, NASA will launch the largest and most powerful space telescope ever built https://t.co/esXgg3HHJq

A London court awarded the ex-wife of Dubai's ruler a divorce settlement of more than $728 million, in a rare case that pulled back the curtain on one of the world’s richest families https://t.co/eFunoArRWA
One hundred times as powerful as Hubble, the James Webb telescope could show the face of Abraham Lincoln on a penny from 24 miles away https://t.co/nlPrIIAO5v
An unprecedented peek inside a dinosaur egg revealed a perfectly preserved oviraptor—and a surprise about the way the animals hatched https://t.co/sZ3MSz2XoF
A jury on Tuesday found Harvard professor Charles Lieber guilty on six counts related to payments he received from a Chinese government talent program https://t.co/vlEmHjm6FQ
One hundred times as powerful as Hubble, the James Webb telescope could show the face of Abraham Lincoln on a penny from 24 miles away https://t.co/jft9LjMyqy
The House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol says it wants to question GOP Rep. Scott Perry about efforts to replace an acting attorney general https://t.co/XHuPYYmxPx
Tennis star Rafael Nadal said he tested positive for Covid-19 after arriving in Spain from a tournament in Abu Dhabi https://t.co/Nw8tidSI48
An unprecedented peek inside a dinosaur egg revealed a perfectly preserved oviraptor—and a surprise about the way the animals hatched https://t.co/o0MxdBbEYw

From @WSJopinion: The party that constantly seeks control over our lives is now governing—or failing to govern—a nation that is spinning wildly out of control, writes @gerardtbaker https://t.co/XdHRYD5RcV
The U.S. plans to distribute 500 million free at-home Covid tests and send federal medical workers to overburdened hospitals, officials said https://t.co/eFPRHZGuMO

A group of 12 missionaries held hostage made a daring overnight escape last week in Haiti, walking for miles over harsh terrain with children in tow, according to Christian Aid Ministries https://t.co/NRQO2eQ55M
Nike is betting that sneakerheads will want to collect virtual kicks in the form of NFTs https://t.co/2vytkVJlFF
The expert ham sniffer of Spain smells 800 hams a day during the Christmas season. He is strained, he said, “at the limit of human possibility.” https://t.co/sjbcV6kNeN
Former President Donald Trump said he received a Covid-19 vaccine booster shot after previously saying he wasn’t likely to get the additional vaccine dose https://t.co/YAlsKu8kjs
From @WSJopinion: On behalf of all Hispanic Americans, I say no más to this politically correct linguistic monstrosity, writes Charlotte Allen https://t.co/SKUDdi5Og5

The expert ham sniffer of Spain is “at the limit of human possibility” smelling 800 hams a day to make sure they are perfect for Christmas.​ ​“I will find a way to sniff 801. Perhaps 802 is possible.” https://t.co/gNnNMYjLWk
An NYU grad has more than $160,000 in student loans and struggles to land a job in her field. So she sells her eggs. https://t.co/Ka8tiptgtC
Remember those giant JNCO jeans from the 1990s? Well, they're back in style. https://t.co/jIXdQuOZlM
Florida officials are preparing to feed manatees lettuce and other greens in an effort to avoid mass starvation caused by poor water quality https://t.co/Yz6WgT6N0M
Former President Donald Trump said he received a Covid-19 vaccine booster shot after previously saying he wasn’t likely to get the additional vaccine dose https://t.co/TXBQ5Fpkgo

Oracle is expected to pay about $95 a share for electronic-medical-records company Cerner, or more than $30 billion, people familiar say, in a deal that could be announced later today https://t.co/jAEBzzCUVZ
Donald Trump filed a lawsuit against New York Attorney General Letitia James, accusing her of a political vendetta and abusing her office to harass him https://t.co/hcajwIldPk

“Spider-Man: No Way Home” opened to a record-setting $253 million at the box office this weekend, amid concerns the spread of the Omicron variant could slow moviegoing #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/ZWYNcUWRnW
New research shows that just 0.01% of bitcoin holders controls 27% of the currency in circulation https://t.co/94sXevu816
YouTube TV and Disney reached a deal to restore access to Disney-owned channels, including ESPN and FX, for YouTube TV subscribers https://t.co/ss3tbc4CIt

Billionaire Elon Musk, the world’s richest person, said he’ll pay more than $11 billion in taxes this year, a disclosure that came after saying last week that he would pay more taxes than any American in history this year https://t.co/atonhOJBmo
What Turkey’s currency crisis has to do with the global supply chain of Nutella https://t.co/pO84QWP63u

A booster dose of Moderna’s Covid-19 vaccine showed signs of working well against the Omicron variant, with the latest lab results suggesting people who are boosted may have good protection against the strain. https://t.co/6OfOSgWK79
Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai denied accusing anyone of sexual assault, suggesting a global wave of concern for her safety was the result of misunderstandings https://t.co/vXuk5hLktg

The Netherlands on Sunday became the first European government to reimpose a lockdown in the face of Omicron. Germany said it would curb travel from the U.K., while Ireland imposed a curfew. https://t.co/2QIZpOQjGe
European countries have set new restrictions in an effort to stem the spread of the Omicron variant, with the Netherlands going into lockdown and Ireland imposing a curfew https://t.co/Hvmap16g3u
Many NYU graduate degrees don’t pay off. Comparing debt loads with early-career earnings, it ranked worst of any university in 15 graduate programs. https://t.co/AXjgxPL2Qf
